TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit BasicHttpMessageSecurity extends System.Object

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Specifies the algorithm suite to use with .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite> object that is returned contains numerous properties that specify security algorithms to use in specific conditions. It also describes various security capabilities of the service.
## Examples [!code-cs[S_UEBasicHttpBinding#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ba_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UEBasicHttpBinding#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.ba_0_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of credential with which the client authenticates.
Docs.value: A member of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpMessageCredentialType> enumeration. The default value is <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpMessageCredentialType>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The return value can be one of the following enumeration members:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpMessageCredentialType>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpMessageCredentialType>
## Examples [!code-cs[S_UEBasicHttpBinding#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ba_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UEBasicHttpBinding#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.ba_1_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Returns whether the algorithm suite to be used for securing messages at the SOAP level should be serialized.
Docs.returns: if the algorithm suite should be serialized; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ShouldSerializeClientCredentialType() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns whether the client credential type should be serialized.
Docs.returns: if the client credential type should be serialized; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Two examples of client credential types are: identity and transport.
